docs.lead_paragraph: The Czech Republic will accept 153 Christian refugees from Iraq who have fled areas controlled by Islamic State, Prime Minister Bohuslav Sobotka said on Monday.

headline.main: Czechs to Take 153 Christian Refugees From Iraq
headline.print_headline: Czechs to Take 153 Christian Refugees From Iraq

docs.snippet: The Czech Republic will accept 153 Christian refugees from Iraq who have fled areas controlled by Islamic State, Prime Minister Bohuslav Sobotka said on Monday.

docs.lead_paragraph: The White House and top lawmakers want to wrap up a year's worth of budget work and let Congress adjourn this coming week until 2016. There are two major bills: A $1.1 trillion government-wide spending measure and a broad renewal of expiring tax breaks for businesses and individuals that could cost hundreds of billions of dollars over the next decade.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mike Berland, a political pollster and corporate crisis manager, has written a diet book that he says will help people win the campaign against fat.

headline.print_headline: In His Campaign Platform, the Goal Is to Lose

docs.lead_paragraph: Mountain visitors are being offered oxygen therapies, oils, pills and more that claim to prevent altitude sickness, but there is little research to prove they work.

headline.main: The Tricky Business of Treating Altitude Sickness
headline.print_headline: Little Evidence for Some ‘Cures’ for Altitude Illness

docs.snippet: Mountain visitors are being offered oxygen therapies, oils, pills and more that claim to prevent altitude sickness, but there is little research to prove they work.

docs.lead_paragraph: A pediatrician writes, “I have never understood why some parents allow participation in any activity that might damage their offspring.”

docs.lead_paragraph: The all-stock merger of equals caps a record year for deal-making, with more than $4 trillion worth of deals announced.

headline.main: Dow Chemical and DuPont Set Merger and Plans to Split
headline.print_headline: Dow and DuPont Merger Means Job Cuts and Federal Scrutiny

byline.original: By LESLIE PICKER and MICHAEL J. de la MERCED

headline.main: A Class in ‘Just Cooking’ Changes Family Meals

docs.abstract: “I have yet to meet a parent who says, ‘I really don’t care what my children eat.’ All we have to do is to look at what we’re doing well and try and do more of that.”
docs.snippet: “I have yet to meet a parent who says, ‘I really don’t care what my children eat.’ All we have to do is to look at what we’re doing well and try and do more of that.”

docs.lead_paragraph: Dow Chemical and DuPont are merging to form a company valued at about $130 billion as they try to counter falling commodities prices and weakness in some key markets that have pressured their giant agriculture and chemicals businesses.

headline.main: DuPont, Dow Chemical Seek Merger, Then 3-Way Split
headline.print_headline: DuPont, Dow Chemical Seek Merger, Then 3-Way Split

docs.snippet: Dow Chemical and DuPont are merging to form a company valued at about $130 billion as they try to counter falling commodities prices and weakness in some key markets that have pressured their giant agriculture and chemicals businesses.

docs.lead_paragraph: The White House and top lawmakers are struggling to wrap up a year's worth of budget work and let Congress adjourn next week for 2015. At issue are a $1.1 trillion government-wide spending bill and a sprawling renewal of tax breaks for businesses and individuals that could cost hundreds of billions of dollars over the next decade.
